intro: Lappula paulsenii, commonly known as the Paulsen's lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and spikes of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Lappula paulsenii is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
